metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 【結果】フィギュア男子シングル 鍵山優真が銀 佐藤駿が銅
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートの男子シングルで、鍵山優真選手が銀メダル、佐藤駿選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。最新情報をお伝えします。

all.headline: スノーボード男子HP 戸塚優斗が金 山田琉聖が銅メダル【詳報】
all.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード男子ハーフパイプの決勝が行われ、3大会連続出場の戸塚優斗選手が金メダル、19歳でオリンピック初出場の山田琉聖選手が銅メダルを獲得し日本選手2人が表彰台に上がりました。

all.headline: 神奈川県警 不適切な取締り約2700件 巡査部長ら書類送検へ
all.description: 神奈川県警の巡査部長ら複数の警察官がスピード違反などの取締りの際に繰り返し、うその書類を作成していたなどとして警察が近く、書類送検する方針を固めたことが捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。巡査部長らによる不適切な取締りはおよそ2700件に上り、警察はこれらの違反を取り消し反則金の返還を進めることにしています。

all.headline: 中道 小川淳也新代表 新体制発足で党立て直しへ
all.description: 中道改革連合の小川淳也 新代表は来週の特別国会を前に新体制を発足させるなど党の立て直しに取り組むことにしています。一方で、立憲民主党と公明党に分かれたままの参議院側の扱いなど課題が山積していて、まずは足元を固められるかが問われることになります。

all.headline: トランプ大統領 中東地域に2隻目の空母を派遣へ イランに圧力
all.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領は、中東地域に2隻目の空母を近く派遣すると明らかにしました。ベネズエラへの軍事作戦に参加した最新鋭の空母と伝えられていて、イランに対し、核開発などをめぐる協議で合意に応じるよう迫るねらいがあるとみられます。

all.headline: 小泉防衛相 欧州同志国などと連結性高める ミュンヘン安保会議
all.description: 小泉防衛大臣はドイツで開かれている「ミュンヘン安全保障会議」のイベントでスピーチし、「欧州大西洋」と「インド太平洋」の安全保障は不可分だとしてヨーロッパの同志国などと訓練や装備品などの連結性を高めていく考えを示しました。

all.headline: 視力「1.0未満」の子ども過去最多 高校生は7割超 文科省
all.description: 視力が1.0に満たない子どもは増加傾向が続いていて、なかでも高校生は7割を占めて、過去最多となるなど、視力の悪化が進んでいることが文部科学省の調査で分かりました。

all.headline: Japan's Yuma Kagiyama matches Beijing performance with silver medal
all.description: Kazakhstan's Mikhail Shaidorov, who took home the men's figure skating title at the Winter Olympics on Friday as U.S. favorite Ilia Malinin finished eighth.

all.headline: Flawless Yuto Totsuka stomps to gold in men's halfpipe
all.description: Australia's Scotty James prevented a Japanese sweep of the podium, with Ryusei Yamada taking bronze and Ruka Hirano finishing fourth.

all.headline: Junya Ogawa elected leader of Centrist Reform Alliance
all.description: The former CDP lawmaker pledged to strengthen the CRA’s internal structure as the party reels from its election defeat.

all.headline: Japan seizes Chinese fishing vessel and arrests captain
all.description: The incident happened inside Japan’s exclusive economic zone off Nagasaki Prefecture, 165 kilometers south-southwest of the island of Meshima.

all.headline: Britain needs so much more than a new prime minister
all.description: Britain has had four failed prime ministers since the Brexit referendum in 2016 not counting Starmer.

all.headline: Max Verstappen labels new F1 car as 'not much fun to drive'
all.description: Formula One is starting a new engine era along with significant changes to the aerodynamics and chassis this season, with the electrical component ‌increased.

all.headline: Japan’s ex-FX chief sees yen firming as Takaichi’s stance clears
all.description: Tatsuo Yamasaki also largely ruled out the likelihood of the United States helping Japan with joint currency intervention.

all.headline: BOJ hawk Tamura flags spring as possible timing for rate hike
all.description: Naoki Tamura's remarks suggest that Gov. Kazuo Ueda will probably face increased opposition if he decides to stand pat at the next policy meetings through April.

all.headline: Two U.S. Marines referred to prosecutors in Tokyo theft case
all.description: Tokyo's Metropolitan Police Department sent papers on two U.S. Marines to public prosecutors on Friday, alleging that they broke into restaurants in Tokyo and stole cash, sources said.

all.headline: Oscars museum dives into world of Miyazaki's 'Ponyo'
all.description: Dozens of drawings, storyboards and other elements created for the film and gifted to the Los Angeles institution by Miyazaki's world-famous Studio Ghibli are going on display.

all.headline: 2026 Has Seen a Grim Dawn in Iran; What Will the Rest of the Year Bring?
all.description: “HAPPY NEW YEAR. Wishing you and your dear family a 2026 full of happiness, health and heartwarming moments.”

all.headline: Council Submits Proposals for Revising Retrial System; Some Legal Experts Say Changes Do Not Go Far Enough
all.description: An advisory body to Justice Minister Hiroshi Hiraguchi has sent the minister a report outlining a set of proposals for revising the nation’s retrial system.

all.headline: Japan, U.S. Fail to Make Final Decision on $550 Bil. Investment Plan Project
all.description: WASHINGTON — Tokyo and Washington failed to make a final decision regarding the inaugural project of a $550 billion (about ¥84 trillion) investment package in the United States on Thursday. The projec

all.headline: Japan’s Ruling Bloc Aims to Reclaim Key Committee Posts in Lower House
all.description: The landslide victory of the ruling parties in the recent House of Representatives election is expected to help them regain control of key posts in the lower house at a special Diet session convening

all.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Mitsuki Ono, Ikuma Horishima Add 2 Bronzes to Medal Tally
all.description: MILAN — Mitsuki Ono, 21, won bronze in the women’s snowboard halfpipe at the Milano Cortina Olympic Games in Livigno, Italy, on Thursday.

all.headline: Ogawa Elected as New CRA Leader, Aims to Work Toward Harmony Within Party
all.description: Former Constitutional Democratic Party of Japan Secretary General Junya Ogawa was elected as the new leader of the Centrist Reform Alliance on Friday.

all.headline: 2 Submersibles Reveal Deep Sea off Sulawesi Island
all.description: ABOARD OCEANXPLORER, Indonesia (AFP-Jiji) — A dome-fronted submersible sinks beneath the waves off Indonesia, heading down nearly 1,000 meters in search of new species, plastic-eating microbes and com

all.headline: Taiwan Chipmaker’s New Factory: Utilize Advanced Products to Boost Japan’s Competitiveness
all.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., the world’s largest contract chipmaker, has decided to produce chips in Japan that are close to being the most cutting-edge.

all.headline: Medal Haul: Young Japanese Athletes Are Lively; Veterans Shine at Olympics
all.description: Japanese athletes have given lively performances and won medals one after another at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics. Their willingness to take on challenges without fear of failure and their dedic

all.description: BERLIN, Feb 12 (Reuters) - The Berlin Film Festival opened on Thursday night with the message that new voices matter as Hollywood legend Michelle Yeoh recalled how the festival supported her early in

Who is Tarique Rahman, set to become Bangladesh's next PM?
all.description: Rahman, the son of two former leaders of Bangladesh, only recently returned to the country after years in exile abroad.

all.headline: Sussan Ley and the glass cliff: Does Australian politics still have a problem with women?
all.description: The Liberal Party elected its first female leader at a time of crisis. She lasted less than a year.

all.headline: Australia's Liberal Party ousts first woman leader
all.description: Sussan Ley, plagued by poor polls, was deposed by Angus Taylor after just nine months in the job.

all.headline: Japan says it seized Chinese vessel amid tensions with Beijing
all.description: The fishing boat tried to flee when ordered to stop for an inspection inside Japan's territorial waters, authorities say.

all.headline: Watchdog to investigate Sydney police after anti-Herzog protest violence
all.description: Videos emerged of police appearing to punch protesters at rally against Israeli president on Monday.

all.headline: Kim Jong Un chooses teen daughter as heir, says Seoul
all.description: South Korea's spy agency says Ki Ju Ae's prominent public presence indicates she is the chosen heir.

all.headline: China's Xi Jinping makes rare reference to recent military purge
all.description: Zhang Youxia, widely seen as Xi's closest military ally, was in January removed from his post.

all.headline: Principal shot in Thailand school siege dies of injuries
all.description: A gunman who laid siege to the school shot the principal and another female student who is out of danger.

all.headline: India orders social media firms to remove unlawful content within three hours
all.description: Critics worry the rules would be a compliance challenge for tech platforms and could expand censorship.

all.headline: Indonesia preparing to deploy up to 8,000 soldiers to Gaza
all.description: It would be the first country to do so as part of phase two of the ceasefire agreement brokered by the US last year.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

competitors.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
competitors.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

competitors.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
competitors.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

competitors.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
competitors.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

competitors.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

competitors.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

primary.headline: 【結果】フィギュア男子シングル 鍵山優真が銀 佐藤駿が銅
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、フィギュアスケートの男子シングルで、鍵山優真選手が銀メダル、佐藤駿選手が銅メダルを獲得しました。最新情報をお伝えします。

primary.headline: スノーボード男子HP 戸塚優斗が金 山田琉聖が銅メダル【詳報】
primary.description: ミラノ・コルティナオリンピック、スノーボード男子ハーフパイプの決勝が行われ、3大会連続出場の戸塚優斗選手が金メダル、19歳でオリンピック初出場の山田琉聖選手が銅メダルを獲得し日本選手2人が表彰台に上がりました。

primary.headline: 神奈川県警 不適切な取締り約2700件 巡査部長ら書類送検へ
primary.description: 神奈川県警の巡査部長ら複数の警察官がスピード違反などの取締りの際に繰り返し、うその書類を作成していたなどとして警察が近く、書類送検する方針を固めたことが捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。巡査部長らによる不適切な取締りはおよそ2700件に上り、警察はこれらの違反を取り消し反則金の返還を進めることにしています。

primary.headline: 中道 小川淳也新代表 新体制発足で党立て直しへ
primary.description: 中道改革連合の小川淳也 新代表は来週の特別国会を前に新体制を発足させるなど党の立て直しに取り組むことにしています。一方で、立憲民主党と公明党に分かれたままの参議院側の扱いなど課題が山積していて、まずは足元を固められるかが問われることになります。

primary.headline: トランプ大統領 中東地域に2隻目の空母を派遣へ イランに圧力
primary.description: アメリカのトランプ大統領は、中東地域に2隻目の空母を近く派遣すると明らかにしました。ベネズエラへの軍事作戦に参加した最新鋭の空母と伝えられていて、イランに対し、核開発などをめぐる協議で合意に応じるよう迫るねらいがあるとみられます。

primary.headline: 小泉防衛相 欧州同志国などと連結性高める ミュンヘン安保会議
primary.description: 小泉防衛大臣はドイツで開かれている「ミュンヘン安全保障会議」のイベントでスピーチし、「欧州大西洋」と「インド太平洋」の安全保障は不可分だとしてヨーロッパの同志国などと訓練や装備品などの連結性を高めていく考えを示しました。

primary.headline: 視力「1.0未満」の子ども過去最多 高校生は7割超 文科省
primary.description: 視力が1.0に満たない子どもは増加傾向が続いていて、なかでも高校生は7割を占めて、過去最多となるなど、視力の悪化が進んでいることが文部科学省の調査で分かりました。

primary.headline: Japan's Yuma Kagiyama matches Beijing performance with silver medal
primary.description: Kazakhstan's Mikhail Shaidorov, who took home the men's figure skating title at the Winter Olympics on Friday as U.S. favorite Ilia Malinin finished eighth.

primary.headline: Flawless Yuto Totsuka stomps to gold in men's halfpipe
primary.description: Australia's Scotty James prevented a Japanese sweep of the podium, with Ryusei Yamada taking bronze and Ruka Hirano finishing fourth.

primary.headline: Junya Ogawa elected leader of Centrist Reform Alliance
primary.description: The former CDP lawmaker pledged to strengthen the CRA’s internal structure as the party reels from its election defeat.

primary.headline: Japan seizes Chinese fishing vessel and arrests captain
primary.description: The incident happened inside Japan’s exclusive economic zone off Nagasaki Prefecture, 165 kilometers south-southwest of the island of Meshima.

primary.headline: Britain needs so much more than a new prime minister
primary.description: Britain has had four failed prime ministers since the Brexit referendum in 2016 not counting Starmer.

primary.headline: Max Verstappen labels new F1 car as 'not much fun to drive'
primary.description: Formula One is starting a new engine era along with significant changes to the aerodynamics and chassis this season, with the electrical component ‌increased.

primary.description: Tatsuo Yamasaki also largely ruled out the likelihood of the United States helping Japan with joint currency intervention.

primary.headline: BOJ hawk Tamura flags spring as possible timing for rate hike
primary.description: Naoki Tamura's remarks suggest that Gov. Kazuo Ueda will probably face increased opposition if he decides to stand pat at the next policy meetings through April.

primary.headline: Two U.S. Marines referred to prosecutors in Tokyo theft case
primary.description: Tokyo's Metropolitan Police Department sent papers on two U.S. Marines to public prosecutors on Friday, alleging that they broke into restaurants in Tokyo and stole cash, sources said.

primary.headline: Oscars museum dives into world of Miyazaki's 'Ponyo'
primary.description: Dozens of drawings, storyboards and other elements created for the film and gifted to the Los Angeles institution by Miyazaki's world-famous Studio Ghibli are going on display.

primary.headline: 2026 Has Seen a Grim Dawn in Iran; What Will the Rest of the Year Bring?
primary.description: “HAPPY NEW YEAR. Wishing you and your dear family a 2026 full of happiness, health and heartwarming moments.”

primary.headline: Council Submits Proposals for Revising Retrial System; Some Legal Experts Say Changes Do Not Go Far Enough
primary.description: An advisory body to Justice Minister Hiroshi Hiraguchi has sent the minister a report outlining a set of proposals for revising the nation’s retrial system.

primary.headline: Japan, U.S. Fail to Make Final Decision on $550 Bil. Investment Plan Project

primary.headline: Milano Cortina 2026: Japan’s Mitsuki Ono, Ikuma Horishima Add 2 Bronzes to Medal Tally
primary.description: MILAN — Mitsuki Ono, 21, won bronze in the women’s snowboard halfpipe at the Milano Cortina Olympic Games in Livigno, Italy, on Thursday.

primary.headline: Ogawa Elected as New CRA Leader, Aims to Work Toward Harmony Within Party
primary.description: Former Constitutional Democratic Party of Japan Secretary General Junya Ogawa was elected as the new leader of the Centrist Reform Alliance on Friday.

primary.headline: 2 Submersibles Reveal Deep Sea off Sulawesi Island

primary.headline: Taiwan Chipmaker’s New Factory: Utilize Advanced Products to Boost Japan’s Competitiveness
primary.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co., the world’s largest contract chipmaker, has decided to produce chips in Japan that are close to being the most cutting-edge.

primary.headline: Medal Haul: Young Japanese Athletes Are Lively; Veterans Shine at Olympics

Who is Tarique Rahman, set to become Bangladesh's next PM?
secondary.description: Rahman, the son of two former leaders of Bangladesh, only recently returned to the country after years in exile abroad.

secondary.description: The Liberal Party elected its first female leader at a time of crisis. She lasted less than a year.

secondary.description: Sussan Ley, plagued by poor polls, was deposed by Angus Taylor after just nine months in the job.

secondary.description: Zhang Youxia, widely seen as Xi's closest military ally, was in January removed from his post.

I am deeply grateful for the congratulatory message from the Prime Minister.
Cooperation with Germany, which leads Europe as a member of the G7, is even more important.

Herzlichen Glückwunsch zu diesem Wahlsieg, liebe @takaichi_sanae.

Japan ist ein wichtiger Partner für Deutschland – uns verbinden gemeinsame Werte und Ziele. Ich freue mich darauf, diese Partnerschaft in den kommenden Jahren weiter auszubauen.

president marcos
@bongbongmarcos
Thank you very much for your warm words of congratulations.
This year, Japan and the Philippines celebrate the 70th anniversary of the normalization of diplomatic relations.

A landslide victory and a powerful mandate from the Japanese people. Congratulations to Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on this historic win.
